item.title: The (un)Ergonomics of React Hooks
item.description: Any veteran of the JavaScript framework landscape would probably agree that the idea of hooks as a superior paradigm as being a little ridiculous. If a linter is required to inform you when you’re writing a bug, one that is not immediately obvious, then this is a failing in the framework to round those sharp edges. Lints are not rounded edges! The simplicity that comes with hooks is a trade-off of complexity that is now completely out of sight, and only appears once the code is run in a linter.
